justification: The authors note that a "memory-experience gap exists for pleasant ... emotions" and that this finding holds "regardless of variations in how the DRM [Day Reconstruction Method] was administered," indicating that pleasant daily emotions were assessed with the DRM.

The same passage states the gap applies to "unpleasant emotions" (anger, sadness, tension) and links this assessment to the DRM, showing that daily unpleasant emotions were measured with the Day Reconstruction Method.
